programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Morgan's first flight over the peaks leaves him in a dead skid over the edge, Marty fights to double down on a big payday, while Eustace bites off more than he can chew to get the job done. Jason takes River on a mountain rite of passage.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An investigation into accounts by witnesses who allegedly saw military helicopters transporting a UFO in Needles, California, in 2008.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team heads to Area 51, the epicentre of UFO conspiracies, to meet former employees of the alleged storage site for alien space craft.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank rummage around a machine shop in search of rare collectibles.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John Thomson and Simon Day go on a humorous tour to examine bizarre traditions in Britain's counties, starting with a visit to the Cornish coast.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John Thomson and Simon Day join a pagan group and take part in a sheepdog trial when they visit Carmarthenshire.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team works on a custom-made car from a 1940s fairground ride, and a client brings in an unusual bicycle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A regular customer brings Rick a hand-powered railway cart from the 1800s, which the team strive to turn into a museum exhibit.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists David Mitchell, Bill Bailey, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies tackle questions about China, Corby and coffee, with points going to the answers host Stephen Fry finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Ruth Jones, Jason Manford, Jack Dee and Peter Serafinowicz join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actress Keeley Hawes, actor Stephen Mangan, comedian Kevin Bridges and physicist Brian Cox for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Jenny Eclair, Johnny Vegas and Bill Bailey join regular panellist Alan Davies for an extended edition of the quiz show, in which Stephen Fry awards points for the answers he finds most interesting - regardless of whether they are correct. This time, the Stephen Fry prepares for the festive period with some seasonal merriment.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Romesh Ranganathan and Holly Walsh joining Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at recent world events, through stand-up and improvised games. First shown in October 2015.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Ruth Jones, Jason Manford, Jack Dee and Peter Serafinowicz join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: As a Protestant, Queen Elizabeth I lived with the threat of assassination from Catholics throughout her reign. Thankfully, there was an army of men available to work in secret under spy master Francis Walsingham with the sole aim of protecting her. As this documentary reveals, Walsingham was able to demonstrate remarkable cunning in his role.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team discovers a link between a mummified body and a Notting Hill house that featured as the location for a murderous fight between gangsters in a 1960s film, and present-day renovation work reveals more skeletons behind the walls. Spencer complicates matters further by revealing he lived there with his family when the events must have taken place. Crime drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Holly Aird.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The maverick detective finds his career on the line once more when an apparently watertight murder prosecution collapses because of his unconventional interrogation methods. Facing the wrath of the victim's family - not to mention his own colleagues - Rebus digs deeper, but finds himself caught up in a spate of gangland revenge killings. Nicholas Farrell guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: Ken and Harry pose as conference organisers in a bid to prove the innocence of a former head of security at a leading hotel, while Rocky and Alex carry out an elaborate burglary.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: The Pledge
programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: Sophy Ridge on Sunday
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news headlines, plus analysis of current affairs issues with leading politicians, a review of stories in the day's national newspapers and weather reports.

programme.title: 50 Greatest Christmas Songs Ever!
programme.desc: The season of goodwill is here, so stay with us for 50 all-time festive favourites. These will warm the cockles of your heart.

programme.title: That Christmas Feeling
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: The Kisstory Takeover
programme.desc: Kisstory is taking over with non-stop old skool and anthems.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: 2019's Biggest Hits
programme.desc: What a year it's been for music! We've got all the biggest hits of 2019 right here.

programme.title: Super Hits & New Releases!
programme.desc: Tune in to these super-hot hits and the latest trending videos. Look no further for today's music fix.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits one of his favourite houses and discovers a design classic, and later visits a museum in a giant windmill.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including baby scales, an oil can and a glass cabinet that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Heavy rains flood Utah and destroy neighbourhoods and an eight storey building collapses in the Filipino capital Manila. Plus, trains crash at a dangerous intersection and a stealth bomber interrupts a picnic.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An earthquake destroys a church, a tornado wreaks havoc in Oklahoma and a Delta 2 rocket explodes at Cape Canaveral.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill is asked to convert a '61 Cadillac. The guys fit a custom interior, suspension, wheels and tyres. Plus, a '63 C-10 gets its twin turbo engine fired up.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Pixie McKenna encounters three huge hernias, and Christian Jessen meets Malissa Jones, who, aged 18, became one of the youngest patients in Britain to undergo an operation to fit a gastric band in 2008.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic experts can use even the tiniest pieces of hair or carpet fibre to identify a criminal.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of devoted wife and hardworking paralegal Cynthia Langrall. When the 57-year-old was shot dead on her morning run, police were baffled as to who would commit the crime. Neighbours told police that they heard two gunshots and a few had spotted a car in the area that was caught on some CCTV footage.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The New Year's Eve 2000 murders of Carl and JoAnna Dutcher and their 15-year-old grandson Tony, in the tiny Rocky Mountain outpost of Guffey. It transpired a school friend of Tony's, Scott Grimes, committed the act because he felt pressured by an older peer group with which he was associated.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Bureau agents notice a pattern emerging when they investigate a series of violent carjackings around Washington DC in 1992.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The story of Oscar, a dog that was brought back from the brink of death by the Arizona Humane Society, before being adopted by Animal Planet producer Michael Massey.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown and Lisa Chimes head out to the Blue Mountains after some of the most intense bushfires on record, to help pets and wildlife in the fire zone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Persia is in search of a specific dress, but no one can locate it, while NFL stars Thomas and Julius Jones secretly plan to purchase their sister Katrice's gown.
